title: How to do quests
description: Learn how the quest mechanics work, including dialogue trees, items, and requirements.

dialogue.text: Welcome to the 'How to do quests' tutorial! In this quest, you'll learn how quests work, including dialogue trees, items, and requirements. Are you ready to start?

Quests consist of multiple trees of dialog. Each dialogue has a series of options, which lets you interactively navigate a maze of different quests and outcomes. When you finish a quest, you can optionally receive a list of items. Let's move on to learn about quest requirements.

Certain quests require other quests to be completed before they can be started. This is done using a property called 'requiresQuests', which is a list. If there are no required quests, this list should be empty. Let's learn about item requirements now.

You can require certain items to unlock certain options on a dialogue turn. For example, you might need 5 3D printers total to enable an option. To do this, you would include an 'itemsRequired' property in the option object. Finally, let's learn about process requirements.

You can require certain processes to be complete before an option is available. Each option can have a 'processId' property filled, which might be something like 'outlet', '3dprint-rocket', etc. You've now learned the basics of how quests work!
